newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Van der Horst in currency note programme.
newsitem.headline: Van der Horst in currency note programme.

text.p: Van der Horst Ltd said on Thursday its wholly-owned subsidiary VHD Holland B.V. is proposing to establish an Asian Currency Note Programme not exceeding US$200 million.
The notes would be issued from time to time and Van der Horst would guarantee the notes, denominated in currencies other than Singapore dollars, it said in a statement.
An application wil be made to list the notes on the Luxembourg Stock Exchange, it said.

"This programme will raise the profile of Van der Horst with the international investment community and at the same time, widen our funding base and increase the versatility of our borrowing requirements," said Freddie Heng, executive director of Van der Horst.
Van der Horst is an engineering and infrastructure development group.
The first tranche of three-year floating rate notes amounting to US$100 million will be arranged by Peregrine Fixed Income Ltd.
The company will hold a series of roadshows in Singapore, Tokyo, Taipei and Hongkong beginning May 9. Syndication is expected to close by end of May, it said.
